FuncDef:
The port command specifies the port to be added to an ERPS ring and sets the port role.
The undo port command deletes a port from the ERPS ring and cancels the port role. The port command specifies the port to be added to an ERPS ring and sets the port role. The undo port command deletes a port from the ERPS ring and cancels the port role. By default, ports are not added to ERPS rings, and no port roles are specified. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ExtraInfo:
After an ERPS ring is created, run the port command to add Layer 2 ports to the ERPS ring to allow transmission of R-APS PDUs. Each device that is added to an ERPS ring is a node, and each node cannot have more than two ports being added to the ERPS ring.
ERPS defines three port roles: RPL owner port, RPL neighbor port (only in ERPSv2), and ordinary port. The link where the RPL owner port resides is the RPL.
